image.altText: a blonde lady standing looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Flinders Medical Centre treated patients in corridors during a recent period of high demand, prompting South Australia's doctor's union to report their concerns to the state's safety watchdog.

title.children: Hospital's corridor care while overcrowded a 'health and safety risk', union says

image.altText: Two men in wetsuits stand together near water

props.synopsis: The former girlfriend of the man believed to be responsible for the deaths of Australian surfers Jake and Callum Robinson tells prosecutors he confessed to her "I f**ked up three gringos", a Mexican court hears.

title.children: Woman arrested in connection to Australian surfer deaths turns star witness

image.altText: Chinese tourists posing to camera in the Blue Mountains.

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of young people in China reportedly see their working holiday visa applications expire as the Australian government quietly suspends issuing the visa for Chinese nationals.

title.children: 'You are a liar': Chinese wannabe working holiday-makers furious over suspension of visa applications

image.altText: A graphic design of a clock sits in between a pair of hands

props.synopsis: Knowing how many hours a day you should sit, stand, move and sleep to be at your healthiest sounds like the wellness holy grail. A new study suggests the best way to spend your 24 hours (if you can).

title.children: What's in your day? Scientists have analysed how we should spend our time for optimum health

image.altText: Whyalla steelworks

props.synopsis: GFG Alliance admits the Whyalla steelworks blast furnace has been damaged during efforts to repair it and the company has pushed back its estimate of when it hopes to restart production.

title.children: 'Grave concerns': Whyalla steelworks shutdown may take longer than anticipated

image.altText: A line of new houses with identically coloured black roofs.

props.synopsis: For the first time in more than 30 years, the profit from business lending is outstripping mortgages. The reason lies in the rise of mortgage brokers.

title.children: Rise of mortgage brokers transforms the profit banks once made on home loans

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair and red glasses looks slightly off camera with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The former South Australian Human Services minister has revealed the diagnosis came as a shock but she has no plans to stop serving as a shadow minister.

title.children: South Australian MLC Michelle Lensink shares breast cancer news

image.altText: A woman stands on crutches with her right knee held up smiling at the camera. The knee is in a blue knee brace

props.synopsis: After three months in a knee brace as part of a research trial, my anterior cruciate ligament healed itself. This novel program could revolutionise the way ACL tears are treated.

title.children: The 'left field' treatment that healed my torn ACL naturally

image.altText: Mother smiles adoringly with her arm around her daughter as they look into each other's eyes.

props.synopsis: Childhood maltreatment is responsible for up to 41 per cent of common mental health conditions including anxiety, depression, substance abuse, self-harm and suicide attempts, according to a new study.

title.children: Four Corners profiled Ange's mum in 1996. Now she's a mum trying to do things differently

image.altText: NSW Police in a gym car park putting up tape

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested after a woman in her 30s was stabbed in the car park of a gym in Alexandria in Sydney's inner south.

title.children: Man arrested over stabbing of woman in Sydney gym car park

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide business owner accused of indecently assaulting women during job interviews across a period of 13 months has been released on electronically monitored home detention bail.

title.children: Businessman accused of indecent assaults in job interviews granted bail

image.altText: A man leans on a glass window.

props.synopsis: Former Victorian racing integrity commissioner Sal Perna is appointed to oversee reforms within South Australia's greyhound industry, after revelations of animal abuse triggered an independent inquiry.

title.children: Greyhound integrity chief appointed after animal abuse revealed by ABC

image.altText: Sun shining through clouds over hills and water behind the Cairns skyline

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old Italian woman was visiting Cairns when she was allegedly sexually assaulted by a 10-year-old boy.

title.children: Police charge 10-year-old boy over alleged mid-morning sexual assault of Italian tourist

image.altText: A woman standing in a bombed out office.

props.synopsis: Across Ukraine, women are doing the dangerous work of reporting on the war from the front line and keeping newsrooms going.

title.children: The women taking on Putin’s propaganda machine from the bunkers of eastern Ukraine

image.altText: Graphic of three teen boys in school uniform looking at a giant phone with "manfluencer" Andrew Tate's face on it.

props.synopsis: As social media algorithms push misogynistic content to teenage boys, other men are trying to model a healthier version of masculinity.

title.children: Teen boys can be 'blinded by the glamour' of misogynistic influencers. Another movement is pushing back

image.altText: Mike and Sue Willett

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth Home Support Program is meant to provide critical supports to help older Australians stay at home longer and ease pressure on the aged care system. But older Australians say they are waiting months for help, and often end up having to just pay for supports themselves.

title.children: Waiting months for handrails or help cleaning, older Australians say a scheme to help them stay at home is failing

image.altText: A cup of bubble tea.

props.synopsis: Farmers hope Australian oats could help provide a low-sugar alternative in bubble tea, the popular Asian desert beverage, which is estimated to be worth more than $4 billion globally.

title.children: Australian scientists have developed a healthier alternative for bubble tea

image.altText: The silhouette of a young man wearing a backpack can be seen between the aisles of a library.

props.synopsis: If you paid off your student loan within the past year, you could be entitled to a juicy little tax return.

title.children: 'My gut dropped': What the HECS changes mean if you've recently paid off your student loan

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair crouching down to check the hoof of a horse.

props.synopsis: Student veterinarians say they are being also being forced into poverty as their debts grow, and many are abandoning their studies before they graduate. The industry says the government must to do more to help.

title.children: Student vets require 52 weeks of 'placement poverty' to graduate. They're devastated by study support snub

image.altText: A fighter jet releases two bright flares as it flies in the air.

props.synopsis: Britain's visiting air force chief is encouraging Australia to release any images it collects of dangerous activity by the Chinese military to help call out Beijing's unacceptable behaviour in the region.

title.children: UK air force chief says Australia should release video of Chinese jet confrontation

image.altText: Ken Henry

props.synopsis: Former Treasury secretary Ken Henry has been involved in putting together more budgets than most, and while he can understand the clamour to bring down inflation, he has a different view to most commentators on what role the budget should play.

title.children: Most economists see Tuesday's budget as an opportunity to rein in spending and bring down inflation — not Ken Henry

image.altText: Dmitry Khoroshev

props.synopsis: Ransomware outfit LockBit once offered a million-dollar bounty for anyone who could 'doxx' its leader.  Now governments including Australia's have obliged.

title.children: Authorities strike back at Russian cybercrime gang by unmasking its alleged kingpin

image.altText: CBA image

props.synopsis: Gas stocks have jumped after the Albanese government released its "Future Gas Strategy" report, retail stocks down heavily. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Gas stocks soar after Albanese government releases its 'Future Gas Strategy', CBA third-quarter cash profit falls 7pc

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Gas company stocks soar after Labor releases its "Future Gas Strategy report"
Super Retail Group shares down more than 4%

image.altText: The backs of three white cars parked on the left-hand side of the street with two council bins in the background

props.synopsis: Residents in a sub-division north of Brisbane are struggling to have their rubbish collected in their narrow street. But planning documents show it meets requirements by the City of Moreton Bay.

title.children: Neighbourhood turns into dump with 'terrible smell' as streets designed too narrow for garbos

image.altText: Ignatius Jones

props.synopsis: The singer of shock rock band Jimmy and the Boys is best known for the hits I'm Not Like Everybody Else and They Won't Let My Girlfriend Talk To Me.

title.children: Jimmy and the Boys frontman Ignatius Jones dies aged 67

image.altText: Diprotodon

props.synopsis: Just over a decade ago, an outback cattle station worker in the NT stumbled across a rare diprotodon fossil sticking out of the red soil. Now fondly known as Shirley, scientists have discovered how old the marsupial is.

title.children: Shirley the giant prehistoric wombat-like marsupial now has an age. And she's old

image.altText: A framed photograph of a man smiling

props.synopsis: A father who lost his son in a fatal bus crash in the NSW Hunter Valley says he is disgusted manslaughter charges were dismissed against driver Brett Button.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus crash victim's father says driver plea deal is 'disgusting'

image.altText: Marco Pantani rides in the mist

props.synopsis: The ghost of Marco Pantani has been everywhere during the first week of the Giro d'Italia, raising uncomfortable questions over his tainted legacy.

title.children: The Giro d'Italia's uncomfortable obsession with its favourite, fallen son

image.altText: A female ice hockey player wearing full uniform and helmet is skating during a game with stick in hand.

props.synopsis: The Philippines doesn't seem like the most likely place for a thriving ice hockey culture, but the country's women's side is rising up the ranks.

title.children: Women's ice hockey is making big strides in tropical Philippines

image.altText: Muhammad Taha sitting on a grey couch wearing a black hoodie.

props.synopsis: From northern Pakistan to Bondi Junction, Muhammad Fahad and Muhammad Taha have been together their whole lives. The former is now helping his friend in his recovery from Joel Cauchi's stabbing and they both want him to stay in Australia.

title.children: My best friend saved my life, says security guard stabbed in Bondi attack

image.altText: A batter, Nathan Lyon, with his helmet risen above his face, facing the bowler

props.synopsis: In an interview with BBC Sport, Australian off-spin bowler Nathan Lyon says he still dreams of winning a Test series in England and India.

title.children: Lyon says Australia would have won Ashes 4-0 if he was not injured

image.altText: Footballer Joselu Mato and his teammates running towards fans after scoring, with his arms outstretched

props.synopsis: Real Madrid show they remain Europe's comeback kings as Joselu's late double rescues them from the brink of elimination to reach the Champions League final.

title.children: Madrid super sub scores two late goals to send Spanish giant to Champions League final

image.altText: Three different petrol station signs with prices on the board

props.synopsis: The average Australian family is currently spending more than $100 a week on fuel, but an economist warns government intervention could worsen inflation.

title.children: Amid record high fuel prices, will there be relief for drivers in the upcoming budget?

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: A jury is set to be chosen for the trial of former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn, who is accused of murdering campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay in 2020.

title.children: Campers Carol Clay and Russell Hill went missing four years ago. Today a murder trial begins

image.altText: Footballer during a match, about to kick the ball, wearing an all-yellow kit

props.synopsis: Three players are recent victims of attacks in Malaysia, with one in hospital after an acid attack and another had their windscreen smashed.

title.children: Malaysian football players recommended to get bodyguards after acid attack
